title: United Cup 2025: Draws, Dates, History & All You Need To Know
description: A host of top stars from both the ATP Tour and the Hologic WTA Tour will compete at the 2025 United Cup in Perth and Sydney, Australia. Team Germany, led by World No. 2 Alexander Zverev, will defend the crown it won at the mixed teams competition in 2024. United States, champion in 2023, boasts Top 5 players Taylor Fritz and Coco Gauff. Other marquee players competing include Iga Swiatek and Hubert Hurkacz for Poland, Stefanos Tsitsipas and Maria Sakkari for Greece, Jasmine Paolini (Italy), Elena Rybakina (Kazakhstan), Alex de Minaur (Australia), Beatriz Haddad Maia (Brazil), Casper Ruud (Norway) and Felix Auger-Aliassime (Canada). When is the United Cup? The 2025 United Cup will be held from 27 December, 2024 to 5 January, 2025. The outdoor hard-court event, established in 2023, will take place at the RAC Arena in Perth and the Sydney Olympic Park Tennis Centre. The tournament director is Stephen Farrow. What is the format at the 2025 United Cup? The event will see 18 teams placed into six groups of three. The group stages will consist of round robin ties where each team will play both other teams in their group. Each tie will consist of one ATP singles match, one WTA singles match and one mixed doubles match. The top team from each group will advance to the quarter-finals, with one quarter-final spot also awarded to the best runner-up team in both Perth and Sydney. When is the draw for the 2025 United Cup? The groups have been announced for the 2025 United Cup: PERTH Group A United States Canada Croatia Group C Greece Kazakhstan Spain Group E China Germany Brazil SYDNEY Group B Poland Czechia Norway Group D Italy France Switzerland Group F Great Britain Australia Argentina What is the schedule for the 2025 United Cup? The third edition of the United Cup will be played in Perth (from 27 December, 2024) and Sydney (from 28 December). The host cities will each stage group play and quarter-finals, with four teams advancing to the semi-finals (4 January, 2025) and final (5 January) in Sydney. The full schedule can be found here.  [ATP APP] What is the prize money for the 2025 United Cup? The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$10,250,000 in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5,125,000 each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money. How can I watch the 2025 United Cup? A full list of broadcasters for the 2025 United Cup can be found here. How can I follow the United Cup? Hashtag: #UnitedCup Facebook: United Cup TikTok: @unitedcuptennis Twitter: @unitedcuptennis Instagram: @unitedcuptennis Who won the last edition of the United Cup in 2024? Germany won the second edition of the United Cup in 2024 with a 2-1 win against Poland in the championship match in Sydney. (Read & Watch). Alexander Zverev, Angelique Kerber, Tatjana Maria, Laura Siegemund, Maximilian Marterer competed for Germany across the event. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

United Cup

All about the mixed teams' tennis event being held in Perth and Sydney, Australia

December 24, 2024

Matt King/2024 Getty Images

The third edition of the United Cup will be held from 27 December 2024 to 5 January 2025. By ATP Staff

A host of top stars from both the ATP Tour and the Hologic WTA Tour will compete at the 2025 United Cup in Perth and Sydney, Australia.

Team Germany, led by World No. 2 Alexander Zverev, will defend the crown it won at the mixed teams competition in 2024. United States, champion in 2023, boasts Top 5 players Taylor Fritz and Coco Gauff.

Other marquee players competing include Iga Swiatek and Hubert Hurkacz for Poland, Stefanos Tsitsipas and Maria Sakkari for Greece, Jasmine Paolini (Italy), Elena Rybakina (Kazakhstan), Alex de Minaur (Australia), Beatriz Haddad Maia (Brazil), Casper Ruud (Norway) and Felix Auger-Aliassime (Canada).

When is the United Cup?
The 2025 United Cup will be held from 27 December, 2024 to 5 January, 2025. The outdoor hard-court event, established in 2023, will take place at the RAC Arena in Perth and the Sydney Olympic Park Tennis Centre. The tournament director is Stephen Farrow.

What is the format at the 2025 United Cup?
The event will see 18 teams placed into six groups of three. The group stages will consist of round robin ties where each team will play both other teams in their group. Each tie will consist of one ATP singles match, one WTA singles match and one mixed doubles match. The top team from each group will advance to the quarter-finals, with one quarter-final spot also awarded to the best runner-up team in both Perth and Sydney.

When is the draw for the 2025 United Cup?
The groups have been announced for the 2025 United Cup:

What is the schedule for the 2025 United Cup?
The third edition of the United Cup will be played in Perth (from 27 December, 2024) and Sydney (from 28 December). The host cities will each stage group play and quarter-finals, with four teams advancing to the semi-finals (4 January, 2025) and final (5 January) in Sydney.

The full schedule can be found here.

 

What is the prize money for the 2025 United Cup?
The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$10,250,000 in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5,125,000 each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money.

Who won the last edition of the United Cup in 2024?
Germany won the second edition of the United Cup in 2024 with a 2-1 win against Poland in the championship match in Sydney. (Read & Watch). Alexander Zverev, Angelique Kerber, Tatjana Maria, Laura Siegemund, Maximilian Marterer competed for Germany across the event.
